intro: Celsia iranica, commonly known as the Iranian celsia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Iran. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing a high degree of drought tolerance. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to reduce water loss. Celsia iranica is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential horticultural value.
